articles.title: To keep AI out of her classroom, this high school English teacher went analog - NPR
articles.description: Forth Worth teacher Chanea Bond says sticking with pen and paper keeps generative artificial intelligence out of her American literature classes.
articles.content:
Stacks of worksheets sit atop desks and tables in Chanea Bond's Fort Worth classroom. Her students all have their own school-issued laptops, but Bond has swapped computers for paper lots of paper.
E… [+8267 chars]
